page.title: 12FECKENHAM CHURCH 2
page.content: The arches separating the lady chaple are decorated with patterns in red and black - ox blood and tar. These were done by ladies in the Parish, one was the doctors wife, who used to live at the end of the square. In the chancel there are some old tongs used for making communion wafers.They were supposidly found in a tunnel going from the church to the Doctors house. By the altar is a carved chair that only the Bishop may sit on. There are two old tables which are supposed to be from the original Blue Coat School. The Blue Coat Fund was originally set up as a fund for the poor and orphaned of the parish to receive education and apprenticeships.The pupils at Feckenham School still receive a Â£50 grant from the fund when they leave for middle school at the age of nine.
